content: Does anybody know if CVX codes for the new coronavirus vaccines are being worked on? Where would we find those?

All the ones that I'm aware of, from around the world, can be found here...
https://terminz.azurewebsites.net/fhir/ValueSet/covid-19-vaccines/$expand
That will do! Thank you so much!

Looks like the CVX codes are: 207, 208, 210, and 212

I was searching 'coronavirus', since the other vaccines are listed as adenovirus, heptatitis, haemophilus, etc. But apparently they're all listed under COVID-19, so my search wasn't matching.
I got the CVX ones from here... https://www2a.cdc.gov/vaccines/iis/iisstandards/vaccines.asp?rpt=cvx
FYI: WHO will be standing up a Product Catalog with codes, including ICD-11, and other metadata...
@Carl Leitner - see the discussions on ICD-11 Codes for COVID-19 Vaccines in the Terminology Stream.

Note the WHO has set some principles around the concept of Vaccine Certificate that we should all keep in mind.
https://www.who.int/news-room/articles-detail/call-for-public-comments-interim-guidance-for-developing-a-smart-vaccination-certificate-release-candidate-1
